Gather 1 valid image per species

Source: R/gather_images.R
gather_images.Rd

There are multiple images per species, and not all image UIDs are valid. This function makes searching for a valid image for each species much easier. Searches for the best name match per species and iteratively tries image UIDs until a viable image is found.

gather_images(
  species,
  options = c("namebankID", "names", "string"),
  include_image_data = FALSE,
  mc.cores = 1,
  verbose = TRUE,
  ...
)

Source

Related function: ggimage::geom_phylopic

species <- c("Mus_musculus","Pan_troglodytes","Homo_sapiens") res <- orthogene:::gather_images(species=species)

Arguments

species

Species list.

options

(character) One or more of citationStart, html, namebankID, root, string, type, uid, uri, and/or votes

include_image_data

Include the image data itself (not just the image UID) in the results.

mc.cores

Accelerate multiple species queries by parallelising across multiple cores.

verbose

Print messages.

...

curl options passed on to crul::HttpClient

Value

data.frame with:

  • species : Species name.

  • uid : Species UID.

  • namebankID : uBio species ID.

  • string : Standardised species name.

  • picid : Image UID.

Details

Contributed by Brian M. Schilder.
